title: Home
text: The Student Affairs Assessment Committee presents Trick or Tips! This website (that may soon disappear as the creator doesn’t know any rules about hosting websites) shares Committee members’ tips and tricks that they acquired during their tenure at the University of Illinois.

title: Data Management
section: Desktop Apps for Box and OneDrive
text:
Desktop Apps for Box and OneDrive

When using programming or statistical software,

title: Data Management
text:
File Format

CSV (Comma-separated values) vs. xlsx (Excel)
Many administrative data (e.g. CPS) are also provided in .sav (SPSS), .dta (Stata), .sas7bdat (SAS).




CSV
XSLX




Size
Small*
Big*


Processing Speed
Fast



Multiple Sheets
No
Yes


Formatting (Colors, etc)
No
Yes








*For larger raw data, csv may be bigger, but still processed at a faster speed. # D
Using R, exporting data (115,112 x 179 dimension) in either csv or xlsx format to OneDrive and Box:




CSV
XSLX




OneDrive

title: Data Management
text:
Consult the following link (cred. Dr. Beth H.):
https://researchit.illinois.edu/resources/topics/backup-and-storage/data-finder




I find using a combination of Box and OneDrive efficient. Below I will explain how I use each.

I strongly recommend downloading the Box and OneDrive desktop clients.

https://www.box.com/resources/downloads
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/onedrive-desktop-app-for-windows-579d71c9-fbdd-4d6a-80ba-d0fac3920aac






While OneDrive is anecdotally now FERPA approved, it is not per https://researchit.illinois.edu/resources/topics/backup-and-storage/data-finder.
Therefore I currently store data, especially with identifiable information, in Box.
Documents (reports, codebook, etc), tables, graphs, etc in Box are static in the sense that I never make direct changes to them.





OneDrive (seemingly) handles syncing changes to files at a higher frequency better than does Box.

Collaboration (e.g. editing MS Word document simultaneously with collaborators) is also easier on OneDrive.

So all document editing, coding, producing tables and graphs, etc. are done in OneDrive.
Files and folders in OneDrive are periodically copied to Box.










Many administrative data (e.g. CPS) are also provided in .sav (SPSS), .dta (Stata), .sas7bdat (SAS).




CSV
XSLX




Size
Small*
Big*


Processing Speed
Fast
Slow


Multiple Sheets
No
Yes


Formatting (Colors, etc)
No
Yes


Analysis (Fns, graphs, etc)
No**
Yes




notes: * For larger raw data, csv may be bigger, but still processed at a faster speed.  ** When csv files are open in MS Excel, functions and graphs can be made but they are not saved unless the file is converted to xlsx

For instance, using R, exporting data (115,112 x 179 dimension) in either csv or xlsx format to a OneDrive folder and a Box folder consumed the following time (s):




CSV
XSLX




OneDrive
12.82
26.40


Box
16.03
30.52




notes: notes: average of 100 iterations shown

title: Google Apps
text:
I wrote Google Apps Script (JavaScript) code that can create Google Calendar events based on Google Sheets shaped as below:

Subtask
Location
Description

End Time
Start Date
End Date

Added?

Birthday
Cancun
Vacation!

Tips and Tricks

9/19/2024


Added to Calendar

Testing
Some kinda retreat
Union
so looong
0900
1700
9/20/2024
9/23/2024


Added to Calendar





While the Google Sheets need to be formatted as above, different formats may be acceptable with modification of the code so please contact me if you need help (mmkang@illinois.edu).
Format a Google Sheets file as the one in the following link or the above table: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11rZJq71bFW5IEldlj3AMY6OPBVhwpdUapR_NdNccjmA/edit?gid=368059972#gid=368059972



Also go to the link below and follow instructions:

https://github.com/MMK36-UIUC/Google-Sheets-to-Calendar/blob/main/Apps%20Script%20Code.js

title: Assessment Tools
text:
Preview

If a survey is complicated (e.g. complicated display logic and branching), preview may be time-consuming.
You can preview only a question or a block.
If you wanna freely browse while in preview mode without completing forced responses, etc., Tools -> Ignore Validation




qualtrics-preview-ignore validation


Webtools
